Pearl Milling Company - Wikipedia
s: November 22, 2024 - In June 2021, the Aunt Jemima brand name was discontinued by its current owner, PepsiCo, with all products rebranded to Pearl Milling Company, the name of the company that produced the original pancake mix product.

Our Story | Pearl Milling Company
s: It is the start of a new day: Aunt Jemima is now Pearl Milling Company. Though the Brand is new to store shelves, the name itself has been a part of our story for over 130 years. Pearl Milling Company was a small mill in the bustling town of St. Joseph, Missouri.

t: Aunt Jemima Brand Renamed Pearl Milling Company, Retiring Racist Stereotype : NPR
s: February 10, 2021 - Aunt Jemima Brand Renamed Pearl Milling Company, Retiring Racist Stereotype Aunt Jemima and other food brands, such as Uncle Ben's, announced a redesign following protests against systemic racism and police brutality in the U.S.

t: Amazon.com : Pearl Milling Company Buttermilk Complete Mix, 2 Pound(Pack of 1) : Grocery & Gourmet Food
s: Before the change to Pearl Milling Company their pancakes were the best. I'm not sure if they've changed ingredients or if it's in my head or not buy it doesn't taste quite the same anymore. However, it's the best brand that I've tried so far so I continue to buy this brand.

t: Pearl Milling Company’s new ads remind customers it used to be Aunt Jemima — without mentioning the racist brand | CNN Business
s: September 3, 2021 - Pearl Milling Company unveiled a new ad campaign this week to remind pancake and syrup lovers that although the brand changed its name from Aunt Jemima earlier this year, it still tastes the same.
